intro: Arthrolepis imbricata, commonly known as the rock spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Arthrolepis imbricata produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
